fortaleza-san-felipe.name: Fortaleza San Felipe
fortaleza-san-felipe.history: Fortaleza San Felipe was built in the 16th century by the Spanish to protect Puerto Plata's port from pirate attacks. Its thick coral stone walls and strategically placed cannons made it an impenetrable defense for over three centuries.

letrero-puerto-plata.name: Puerto Plata Sign
letrero-puerto-plata.description: The iconic welcome sign to Puerto Plata
letrero-puerto-plata.history: The iconic Puerto Plata sign on the boardwalk has become the most recognizable symbol of the city. Installed as part of the boardwalk renovation, it represents local pride and is the favorite meeting point for tourists and locals to capture the perfect memory.

calle-de-las-sombrillas.name: Umbrella Street
calle-de-las-sombrillas.description: A beautiful street decorated with colorful umbrellas
calle-de-las-sombrillas.history: Umbrella Street is a vibrant artistic installation that transforms an ordinary street into a tunnel of colors. Hundreds of multicolored umbrellas hang overhead, creating a unique visual spectacle that symbolizes the joy and creativity of the Dominican people.

calle-rosada.name: Pink Street
calle-rosada.description: A street painted pink with colonial charm
calle-rosada.history: Do√±a Blanca's Patio, known as Pink Street, is a colonial architectural gem dating from the 16th century. Its pastel pink painted walls and perfectly preserved Spanish architecture make it one of the most photographed streets in Puerto Plata.

parque-central-de-puerto-plata.name: Central Park of Puerto Plata
parque-central-de-puerto-plata.description: The heart of the city, meeting point and cultural events
parque-central-de-puerto-plata.history: Central Park is the nerve center of Puerto Plata, surrounded by colonial architecture and local life. It's the place where festivals, concerts and cultural events that define the city's spirit are held.

catedral-san-felipe.name: San Felipe Cathedral
catedral-san-felipe.history: San Felipe Cathedral is an example of colonial religious architecture and a central point of the city. Built in the 16th century, it has witnessed Puerto Plata's history and continues to be a place of worship and pilgrimage.

teleferico.name: Cable Car
teleferico.description: The cable car that takes you to Pico Isabel de Torres
teleferico.history: The Puerto Plata Cable Car is the only funicular in the Caribbean and offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city and the Atlantic Ocean. It takes you up to Pico Isabel de Torres, where you'll find botanical gardens and a statue of Christ the Redeemer.

museo-del-ambar.name: Amber Museum
museo-del-ambar.description: Museum dedicated to Dominican amber and its history
museo-del-ambar.history: The Amber Museum houses the world's most important collection of Dominican amber. These fossilized resins from 15-40 million years ago contain perfectly preserved insects, plants and small animals, offering a unique window into the island's prehistoric past.

calle-de-las-sombrillas.name: Umbrella Street
calle-de-las-sombrillas.description: A beautiful street decorated with colorful umbrellas
calle-de-las-sombrillas.history: Umbrella Street is a vibrant artistic installation that transforms an ordinary street into a tunnel of colors. Hundreds of multicolored umbrellas hang overhead, creating a unique visual spectacle that symbolizes the joy and creativity of the Dominican people.

calle-rosada.name: Pink Street
calle-rosada.description: A street painted pink with colonial charm
calle-rosada.history: Do√±a Blanca's Patio, known as Pink Street, is a colonial architectural gem dating from the 16th century. Its pastel pink painted walls and perfectly preserved Spanish architecture make it one of the most photographed streets in Puerto Plata.

letrero-puerto-plata.name: Puerto Plata Sign
letrero-puerto-plata.description: The iconic welcome sign to Puerto Plata
letrero-puerto-plata.history: The iconic Puerto Plata sign on the boardwalk has become the most recognizable symbol of the city. Installed as part of the boardwalk renovation, it represents local pride and is the favorite meeting point for tourists and locals to capture the perfect memory.

teleferico.name: Cable Car
teleferico.description: The cable car that takes you to Pico Isabel de Torres
teleferico.history: The Puerto Plata Cable Car is the only funicular in the Caribbean and offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city and the Atlantic Ocean. It takes you up to Pico Isabel de Torres, where you'll find botanical gardens and a statue of Christ the Redeemer.

fortaleza-san-felipe.name: Fortaleza San Felipe
fortaleza-san-felipe.history: Fortaleza San Felipe was built in the 16th century by the Spanish to protect Puerto Plata's port from pirate attacks. Its thick coral stone walls and strategically placed cannons made it an impenetrable defense for over three centuries.

calle-de-las-chichiguas-cometas.name: Kite Street (Chichigua)
calle-de-las-chichiguas-cometas.description: A colorful street full of traditional Dominican kites
calle-de-las-chichiguas-cometas.history: Kite Street is famous for its colorful urban art and the tradition of flying kites during local festivals. This street represents the joy and creativity of the Dominican people through art and popular traditions.

museo-del-larimar.name: Larimar Museum
museo-del-larimar.description: Museum dedicated to the national stone of the Dominican Republic
museo-del-larimar.history: The Larimar Museum displays the exclusive blue semiprecious stone of the Dominican Republic, showing its history and extraction. Larimar is a unique stone found only in this region of the world.

museo-general-gregorio-luperon.name: General Gregorio Luper√≥n Museum
museo-general-gregorio-luperon.description: Museum dedicated to General Gregorio Luper√≥n
museo-general-gregorio-luperon.history: This museum honors the life and legacy of Gregorio Luper√≥n, a key figure in Dominican history. Luper√≥n was a military and political leader who fought for the independence and sovereignty of the Dominican Republic.

monumento-hermanas-mirabal.name: Mirabal Sisters Monument
monumento-hermanas-mirabal.description: Monument in honor of the Mirabal sisters
monumento-hermanas-mirabal.history: The monument honors the Mirabal Sisters, symbol of the struggle for freedom and human rights in the Dominican Republic. Known as "The Butterflies", they were heroines who fought against the Trujillo dictatorship.

cristo-redentor.name: Christ the Redeemer
cristo-redentor.description: Iconic monument on Pico Isabel de Torres
cristo-redentor.history: Christ the Redeemer crowns Pico Isabel de Torres and is one of Puerto Plata's most recognized monuments. This imposing statue offers spectacular views of the city and ocean, being a symbol of faith and hope.

neptuno-malecon.name: Neptune Boardwalk
neptuno-malecon.description: Neptune monument on Puerto Plata's boardwalk
neptuno-malecon.history: The Neptune statue is an icon of Puerto Plata's boardwalk, representing the city's relationship with the sea. This monument symbolizes the importance of the ocean in Puerto Plata's life and culture.

ocean-world.name: Ocean World
ocean-world.description: Water park and dolphinarium in Puerto Plata
ocean-world.history: Ocean World is one of the most complete water parks in the Caribbean, ideal for family fun. It offers shows with dolphins, sea lions and other marine species, plus exciting water activities.

ron-factory.name: Rum Factory
ron-factory.history: The Rum Factory represents the rich tradition of rum production in the Dominican Republic, with artisanal methods that have been maintained for generations. Here you can learn about the production process and taste the best rums in the country.

home.hero_desc: Explore the most emblematic places of Puerto Plata with our interactive audio guide. Scan QR codes and immerse yourself in the rich history of this beautiful Caribbean city.
home.main_features_desc: Discover everything our platform has to offer you
home.easy_access_desc: Scan QR codes to instantly access exclusive content
home.map_locations_desc: Find all points of interest on an interactive map
home.services_restaurants_desc: Find restaurants, supermarkets, taxis, guides and more local services
home.travel_alarm_desc: Set up alerts so you don't miss your return transportation
home.popular_locations_desc: Discover the most visited and exciting places in Puerto Plata.
home.testimonials_desc: What our users say about their experience.
home.discover_more_content: Discover more places, audios and experiences. Join our community to access exclusive content.

footer.description: Discover the history and culture of Puerto Plata through interactive QR codes. Your personal QR Tour guide.

faq.how_to_use_qr_description: Simply scan the QR code with your phone camera and instantly access detailed information and informative audio.
faq.access_duration_description: Access depends on your subscription plan. Basic plans have limited access, while premium plans offer full 24/7 access.
faq.available_languages: In what languages are the audios available?
faq.available_languages_description: We currently offer audios in Spanish, English and French. We are working to add more languages.
faq.technical_issues: What to do if I have technical problems?
faq.technical_issues_description: If you experience any problems, contact our technical support via WhatsApp or email. We respond within 24 hours.
faq.how_long_access: How long do I have access?
faq.how_long_access_description: Access lasts for the duration of your active subscription. You can renew it at any time.

sombrilla-001.name: Umbrella Street
sombrilla-001.history: Umbrella Street is a vibrant artistic installation that transforms an ordinary street into a tunnel of colors. Hundreds of multicolored umbrellas hang above, creating a unique visual spectacle that symbolizes the joy and creativity of the Dominican people.

rosada-002.name: Pink Street
rosada-002.description: A street painted pink with colonial charm
rosada-002.history: Do√±a Blanca's Patio, known as Pink Street, is a colonial architectural gem dating from the 16th century. Its pastel pink painted walls and perfectly preserved Spanish architecture make it one of the most photographed streets in Puerto Plata.

ambar-003.name: Amber Museum
ambar-003.history: The Amber Museum houses one of the world's most important amber collections, including pieces with fossilized insects and plants from millions of years ago. Dominican amber is considered one of the most valuable in the world for its purity and color.

catedral-san-felipe.name: San Felipe Cathedral
catedral-san-felipe.history: San Felipe Cathedral is an example of colonial religious architecture and a central point of the city. Built in the 16th century, it has witnessed Puerto Plata's history and continues to be a place of worship and pilgrimage.

cristo-redentor.name: Christ the Redeemer
cristo-redentor.description: Iconic statue on Isabel de Torres Peak
cristo-redentor.history: The Christ the Redeemer statue on Isabel de Torres Peak is a replica of the famous statue in Rio de Janeiro. Located 800 meters above sea level, it offers a spectacular panoramic view of the entire city of Puerto Plata.

teleferico.name: Cable Car
teleferico.description: The cable car that takes you to Isabel de Torres Peak
teleferico.history: The Puerto Plata Cable Car is the only funicular in the Caribbean and offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city and the Atlantic Ocean. It takes you up to Isabel de Torres Peak, where you'll find botanical gardens and a statue of Christ the Redeemer.

museo-del-ambar.name: Amber Museum
museo-del-ambar.description: Museum dedicated to Dominican amber and its history
museo-del-ambar.history: The Amber Museum houses the world's most important collection of Dominican amber. These fossilized resins from 15-40 million years ago contain perfectly preserved insects, plants and small animals, offering a unique window into the island's prehistoric past.

museo-del-larimar.name: Larimar Museum
museo-del-larimar.description: Museum dedicated to the national stone of the Dominican Republic
museo-del-larimar.history: The Larimar Museum exhibits the most complete collection of this unique semiprecious stone from the Dominican Republic. Larimar, also known as 'Caribbean stone', is found only in this region of the world and is prized for its unique blue color.

museo-general-gregorio-luperon.name: General Gregorio Luper√≥n Museum
museo-general-gregorio-luperon.description: Museum dedicated to the Dominican national hero
museo-general-gregorio-luperon.history: This museum honors the memory of General Gregorio Luper√≥n, one of the most important heroes of Dominican independence. It exhibits historical documents, weapons and personal objects that tell the life and work of this military and political leader.

parque-central-de-puerto-plata.name: Central Park of Puerto Plata
parque-central-de-puerto-plata.description: The heart of the city, meeting point and cultural events
parque-central-de-puerto-plata.history: Central Park is the nerve center of Puerto Plata, surrounded by colonial architecture and local life. It's the place where festivals, concerts and cultural events that define the city's spirit are held.

monumento-hermanas-mirabal.name: Mirabal Sisters Monument
monumento-hermanas-mirabal.description: Monument in honor of the heroines of freedom
monumento-hermanas-mirabal.history: This monument pays tribute to the Mirabal Sisters, Patria, Minerva and Mar√≠a Teresa, symbols of the struggle for freedom and democracy in the Dominican Republic. Their legacy of courage and resistance continues to inspire current generations.

ron-factory.name: Rum Factory
ron-factory.history: This rum factory represents the centuries-old tradition of rum production in the Dominican Republic. Visitors can learn about the distillation process and taste some of the country's best rums.

neptuno-malecon.name: Neptune Boardwalk
neptuno-malecon.description: Neptune statue on Puerto Plata's boardwalk
neptuno-malecon.history: The Neptune statue on the boardwalk is a symbol of Puerto Plata's connection to the sea. This imposing sculpture represents the god of the sea and is an iconic landmark for boardwalk visitors.

calle-rosada.name: Pink Street
calle-rosada.description: A street painted pink with colonial charm
calle-rosada.history: Do√±a Blanca's Patio, known as Pink Street, is a colonial architectural gem dating from the 16th century. Its pastel pink painted walls and perfectly preserved Spanish architecture make it one of the most photographed streets in Puerto Plata.

ocean-world.name: Ocean World
ocean-world.description: Marine park and aquarium in Puerto Plata
ocean-world.history: Ocean World is one of the most important marine parks in the Caribbean, where visitors can interact with dolphins, sea lions and other marine species. It offers educational and entertainment experiences for the whole family.

how_to_scan_qr: How to scan a QR code?
open_camera_description: Open your phone's camera app. If your device allows it, you can also use a QR scanning app.
focus_qr_code_description: Make sure the QR code is centered and visible on the screen.
tap_notification_description: When the notification appears, tap it to open the link.
open_link_description: The exclusive content will open in your browser.
tip_1: Make sure you have good lighting.
tip_2: If it doesn't work, clean the camera and try again.
tip_3: Some devices require a special QR app.
